Articles.Content:
Title: Journey to the center of the Mun

Specs: 

Cpu: 12th Gen Intel i7-12700H 

Cpu freq: 1.688 GHz

Cpu cores: 14

cpu logical cores: 20

Ram: 15.71GB

Video card: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 Laptop GPU

VRam: 8GB

Severity: Med/Low

Frequency: Low - Happened once. Havent tried to replicate.

Description: I was attempting to land on the Mun (my first time every getting this far!) I had a simple landing craft, while coming towards the mun I went to warp so I could get closer before burning to slow so I could hopefully land, well the warp went MUCH faster than expected, throwing my into the Mun so fast I clipped through it, which at this point I had to continue my journey through the center of the Mun before gliding out of the crust and slowing myself to attempt a landing. (I failed btw)  I would share the file and or pictures of my craft but my game is continueing to crash and im losing my saves. EPIC journey!

Welcome to the forum and thanks for contributing!

This reads like a mission report, lol. Sounds like a wild ride. So, your craft first survived going through the Mun's surface? 

Can you share a picture? Postimages.org works great for uploading to these forums. I want to recreate this.

BIG UPDATE: I have done it once again! Now I want you to realize I obviously suck at trying to land on the Mun I am much better at traveling through it! This time I have 3 images, one is where I am inside of the mun.... yeah the one of the mun. 1 image will show you me approaching the surface of the mun from within the mun, and another shows me surviving exiting the mun. The only thing I did that was the same is I set impact for the Mun, and put warp allll the way up. Dont touch it, just let yourself collide. It worked perfectly.

https://postimg.cc/gallery/9j2mz11 

@Socraticat - I know you wanted to try this.

6 hours ago, FroggieJonnie said:

@Socraticat - I know you wanted to try this.

 

Mwah-hahaha!!!

FYI, lately I've moved to imgur to upload photos. Postimages has given me errors the last few times I've uploaded through the service.

I still have Postimages bookmarked for the easy, no sign-up, resizable upload option.
